Posts.Content: Thanks for all your quick replies. They know that the nodes are affected and I know that they are going to remove some nodes tomorrow. How many I am not sure. I did not have any dye injected during my biopsy of the under arm though. Thanks for all your wishes and advises. Really appreciate.  Thanks, R.
Posts.Title: what is sentinal node biopsy?

Posts.Content: Hi all, Hope everyone is doing well.  I have my mastectomy tomorrow. They will also remove my lymph nodes as they were affected.  I keep reading posts about women having sentinal node biopsy along with their surgery. What is this? I don't want to google and stumble onto something nasty just before my surgery but would like to know what this is. When I first had my biopsy of the breast they also did a biopsy in the under arms as I felt a lump there as well. Is this sentinal node biopsy?  Thanks R.
Posts.Title: what is sentinal node biopsy?

Posts.Content: Well done. Congratulations. Very happy for you.  R
Posts.Title: DONE IT !!!

Posts.Content: Last chemo! Well done and food luck Bevb.  GnJ that's hilarious.  R.
Posts.Title: Steroids

Posts.Content: Thanks for replying Baki and Carolyn.  I met the oncologist after the bone scan when I was told that they can see something suspicious and asked me to have the MRI and CT. I called them after a week to ask for the results. That's when I was told that it is definitely cancer that's come back. It's only in the spine and nowhere else. Since the bone is weak they have sent my case to the National ortho hospital who will decide if I need surgery. I will meet the oncologist after he has heard from the ortho specialists. For now all I can do is wait and wait some more. This is the worst time when your mind thinks of all possible negative outcomes!!  I had ER+PR+ HER2-ve.  I was on tamoxifen.  How did it come back within a year is beyond my understanding. Well somethings in life don't have any explanations I suppose.  R.
Posts.Title: Cancer in spine

Posts.Content: Is PET CT different from whole body CT? I will ask my onco for that. I was only on tamoxifen. No hormonal pills. R.
Posts.Title: Cancer in spine

Posts.Content: Reading through the PET CT information, I realise that this was the first scan that I had. This was then followed by whole body MRI and CT.  Thanks for all your wishes. I will keep you posted on any updates. R.
Posts.Title: Cancer in spine

Posts.Content: Hi all This is the update on my status. Met my onco on Friday. I will be having 10 sittings of radiation. Had the first one on Friday already. My medication has been changed to Letrozol. I've also been prescribed calcium and Vitamin D pills. I will be having a bone strengthening infusion once a month forever! I am also being part of a trial where in I will be scanned every 12 weeks. I've been told that since this is a secondary cancer they cannot cure it but can only keep it under control. I read about this prior to seeing the onco but when he actually said this I was very upset and almost broke down. But I suppose this is the best I can get.  My emotions are very mixed at the moment. At times I feel very positive but at times I am a complete wreck.  R.
Posts.Title: Cancer in spine

Posts.Content: Hi All, I finished my treatment for primary breast cancer in July 2015. For the past couple of months I've been having some back pain. Had a bone scan, MRI and  CT which shows that cancer is back in my spine!! I am so worried. I am going to meet the oncologist on Friday to discuss the treatment options. Has anyone had the same? Is this considered stage 4? Is this metastasis? I am being told that I might need surgery as the bone in that area has become weak. Anyone knows what type of surgery this is?  I was so positive since I finished treatment the first time. I am 34 and I thought I would at least  be fine for a while!! This is just so not what I expected.  Sorry about the rant.  R.
Posts.Title: Cancer in spine

Posts.Content: Thanks Carolyn. The 12 week scan is what puts me at ease a little. This way they can catch anything early.  My husband comes with me to all the hospital visits. So he knows. I haven't told my parents yet. That's going to be very difficult but I'll have a talk with them soon. I have a 7 yr old daughter. We have decided not to tell her anything at this point.  R.
Posts.Title: Cancer in spine

Posts.Content: Thanks for your replies Anne, Bon and Baki. Good luck and big hugs to all of you going through this.  Baki, I will send you a private message about the trial.  R.
Posts.Title: Cancer in spine

Posts.Content: Oh that's wonderful. Congratulations. Enjoy your champagne R.
Posts.Title: Fantastic News!

Posts.Content: Take care Mo. Recovering is more important than any errands. My moto for the first week after chemo is eat well, rest well. I don't mind duvet days if that's what my body needs.  R.
Posts.Title: Over dit it today.

Posts.Content: Hi Sam, So sorry about your diagnosis. I was 32 when diagnosed last dec. I am now almost 2 months post treatment. Had chemo, mastectomy and rads. I went on a lovley holiday post treatment. I went back to work last week. What  i am trying to say is there is light at the end of the tunnel but you have to go through it. Of course, chemo was a little difficult to go through. But everyone is different. Surgery and rads were relatively easy.  Good luck for tuesday and for the rest of your treatment.  R.
Posts.Title: New to here

Posts.Content: Hi, Like you, I was diagnosed with stage 3 ER+ BC. Had chemo and surgery. I had my periods up until the last chemo in April 2015and then they stopped. I am 33 and the oncologist said given my age he is very sure that my periods will return even though I am on tamoxifen. He asked me to inform him when I get my periods again and at that stage he will decide the best course of action to stop it and removing ovaries was one of the options he mentioned. I was a little worried when he said that but have decided to cross the bridge when it comes.  R.
Posts.Title: OVARY REMOVAL ER+ BC

Posts.Content: Pre-ops are usually to check if you are fit for the surgery. But, you should've been informed about the surgery much before this. I met with my surgeon several times before surgery and was explained everything. Is it possible to walk-in to meet your BCN tomorrow?  Hope you get in touch with someone tomorrow. Good luck.  R.
Posts.Title: NO DISCUSSION

Posts.Content: Thamms for your responses. My temperature was 38.9 last night. i feel fine now though. I will surely call the BCN tomorrow and let them know.  Am I the only one having the infusion every 4 weeks?  R.
Posts.Title: Bisphosphonate side effects

Posts.Content: Thats awesome. Congrats Bev.
Posts.Title: yahooo

Posts.Content: Hi George, can I ask your age if you don't mind? I am 32 had my 3rd chemo today but my periods haven't stopped yet. Was wondering what's happening.  Thanks R.
Posts.Title: Chaotic week

Posts.Content: Hi all I had my 5th chemo (2nd T) on the 19th. I am still getting my periods regularly. This time when it started, the flow was so heavy with heavy clots. I had to run to the toilet every half an hour. This happened during the night and by morning I was back to normal. Now after two days of normal bleeding the same thing is happening  again.  I am unable to manage this and am worried why there are so many clots. The clots are so big they push the tampon out so I've stopped using tampon now. Sorry for giving out gross details but would like to know if any of you have experienced this or know what to do.  Thanks R.
Posts.Title: periods

Posts.Content: hi all i received my first bisphosphonate infusion on friday. Since yesterday I have high fever. I am taking paracetamol and felt fine this morning but now the fever is back. is this normal and any idea how long this will last ?  Worried that I might have to go through this every month!! Thanks R
Posts.Title: Bisphosphonate side effects

Posts.Content: Thanks for your replies Butterfly2212 and Quiltmags. I had to go to the A&E as the flow just wouldn't reduce and the size of the clots looked liked my internal organs falling one by one. I was admitted in the Gynaecology ward. They gave me blood transfusion. So I had two bags of blood for supper last night. They also gave me tranexamic acid to reduce bleeding. I am back home now.  Wonder what else chemo has in store for me. The only thing that keeps me going is I only have one more chemo to go.  R.
Posts.Title: periods

Posts.Content: Thanks Amanda. Its stressful when I have periods and chemo at the same time. My onc said it may or may not stop because of my age. Anyway it is what it is. Good luck for the rest of your treatment.  R.
Posts.Title: Chaotic week

Posts.Content: Hi all, Hope everyone is doing well. l had my final chemo yesterday.. Yaayyy!!  First hurdle in the treatment cleared. Looking forward to the surgery now. I don't have a date yet. But now I am just relaxing.  Thanks to everyone who helped me with all my queries during the past few months.  Thanks, R
Posts.Title: Final chemo done.... woohoo!!

Posts.Content: Thanks for all your wishes. Onwards and upwards it is.  Regards, R.
Posts.Title: Final chemo done.... woohoo!!

Posts.Content: Hi Ali, yes general is a general anaesthetic. Although I haven't been told what I will be given. Will let you know on the 8th when I get mine done.  R
Posts.Title: port

Posts.Content: Hi all. I am new to the group. A little bit of introduction- was diagnosed with breast cancer a month ago, had my first chemo (FEC) last week. one down five more to go. However, my veins were difficult to find even for the first cycle so I've been told I must get the portacath. I am having the procedure done on the 8th. If anyone has gone through this procedure can you please advice me what to expect as I am a bit nervous and unsure about this. Thanks R.
Posts.Title: port

Posts.Content: Thanks for the replies. Hopefully it makes life a bit easier R
Posts.Title: port

Posts.Content: Oh dear! So sorry to hear that. Wishing your hubby a speedy recovery.  R.
Posts.Title: Here we go again.

Posts.Content: Hi It usually starts the next day. Although if you have been given Domperidone which is in case you have extreme sickness you can have them today if needed.  Good luck.  R.
Posts.Title: medication at home

Posts.Content: Yes dexamethasone (steroids)is for 3 days only. This is after breakfast and lunch to be taken from tomorrow.  Domoperidone is only if needed not exceeding thrice a day. You will have ondansetron which is anti sickness to be taken from tomorrow before breakfast and dinner.  Hope this helps.  R.
Posts.Title: medication at home

Posts.Content: Hi, I am 32 and was diagnosed in December. I am having chemo currently. Have had 4 cycles, 2 more to go. After this I will have surgery and then radiation. I completely understand how you feel. I was shocked and scared too in the beginning. But I can tell you that all this is doable. Just listen to your body and if you are tired take rest. Don't stress.  Good luck for your treatment.  R.
Posts.Title: Which Treatment 1st??

Posts.Content: Oh! That's strange.  Do you have any number for the chemo unit that you call tomorrow?  I was given a number for day time and another one for out of hours. The out of hours staff in my hospital are no good but there are other ladies here who say they have good staff. I would suggest give them a call tomorrow as you medication starts only tomorrow. If you are unable to get any help then I would suggest you have domperidone starting tomorrow.  Sorry that you are going through this on your first chemo.  R.
Posts.Title: medication at home

Posts.Content: Hi all. Hope everyone is doing well. I had my port fixed yesterday. It was very painful and not at all what I was expecting it to be. I was kept under observation for 4 hrs after the procedure. Every time I moved even an inch the neck hurt very badly. I thought I would be alright in a while but  its the same this morning. Am alright as long as I dont change my position. But every time I change my position I feel the pain and feel a weight pulling down my chest. Any one experienced this?  I am tired of it already. This week was supposed to be my one good week before I go for my second chemo on the 14th!  R.
Posts.Title: port painful?

Posts.Content: Hi Mo, Hope you had a good nights sleep without sickness.  R.
Posts.Title: medication at home

Posts.Content: So sorry that you feel this way. Be positive, that's what will help you get through this tough time. Its great that the lump has reduced. Good luck.  Hugs R.
Posts.Title: Very scared

Posts.Content: Thanks for the replies. I was really concerned as every time I sneeze I feel something pulling in the neck area. I went to the chemo unit today and they said that's normal and that everything looked alright. That's a little reassuring. Waiting to have my chemo through the port on Wednesday.  R.
Posts.Title: port painful?

Posts.Content: Hi. Sorry to hear your news. I am 32 as well and was diagnosed last month. My lymph node is affected as well. Staying positive and husband's support are what is helping me. I've had one cycle of chemo five more to go.  Stock your fridge with food before your chemo as you may be very tired for the next week or two.this forum is really good and you'll get a lot of support here. wish you good luck.  R.
Posts.Title: Just been diagnosed

Posts.Content: Hi. Sorry to hear your news. I am 32 as well and was diagnosed last month. My lymph node is affected as well. Staying positive and husband's support are what is helping me. I've had one cycle of chemo five more to go.  Stock your fridge with food before your chemo as you may be very tired for the next week or two.this forum is really good and you'll get a lot of support here. wish you good luck.  R.
Posts.Title: Just been diagnosed

Posts.Content: Looks like I am the only one who doesn't get these letters. Will definitely ask then when I go this Friday.  Thanks, R.
Posts.Title: which diagnosis is right ?

Posts.Content: I never get any letter regarding diagnosis or treatment by post! All I get are appointment letters. Should I specifically ask? It would be good to have a written record of what my diagnosis was and what treatments I have received.  Thanks, R.
Posts.Title: which diagnosis is right ?

Posts.Content: I am currently having Zoladex injections. Had for the last two months and will continue till I get my ovaries removed (waiting for the surgery dates). Other than the odd hot flushes I haven't had any other side effects. Of course  I haven't had my periods since he last injection. I haven't had any joint pains or tiredness. At least not due to Zoladex.  Hope everything goes well for you. Good luck.  R.
Posts.Title: Zoladex and Letrozole - acupuncture therapy?

Posts.Content: Hi all, Had my mastectomy yesterday. I chose to have delayed reconstruction. I am back home today. Still drowsy from the anesthetic but other than that I am fairly alright. Crossed two hurdles(chemo and surgery) just radiation to go. Woohoo.  Regards, R.
Posts.Title: surgery done. Nearing the end of this journey

Posts.Content: I have the same question. When I asked my surgeon during my post op discussion he said once I am done with the treatment, the BCN and oncologist will let me know of ways to check and symptoms to look out for. I am having my rads. 7 done, 8 more to go. I thought someone will talk to me about this after my rads.  R.
Posts.Title: How do you know if you have mets

Posts.Content: Hi all, Hope everyone is enjoying their Sunday. Has anyone's tongue turned black due to chemo? I had a few black spots on the tip of my tongue right from birth. Over the years that spread and I had more black spots on both the sides but it was not much. Recently I've noticed that my whole tongue is turning black. It is not spots it is like black paint spread on my tongue just like how my nails are gradually turning black. Is it just me or has anyone had this? I will ask my chemo nurse when I go next but if anyone can give me any advise or suggestion that would be great.  Thanks R.
Posts.Title: tongue

Posts.Content: Thanks George n Jackie and Liz. I will check with the chemo unit tomorrow. I hope this is something that can be treated easily. Don't like the look of my tongue.  R.
Posts.Title: tongue

Posts.Content: Wow! Congratations. This is great news.  R.
Posts.Title: No worrying features!

Posts.Content: Hi, Sorry that you are going through this. I am 32 and was diagnosed in December. Once the GP refers your daughter to the specialist, the specialist at the hospital will examine and send her for an ultrasound. During the ultrasound they will decide if it is a cyst or if it needs further examination like mammogram and biopsy.  Hope this turns out to be nothing. Good luck.  R.
Posts.Title: Daughter

Posts.Content: Thanks for your reply cycling girl. Are you going to have radiation after surgery?  Thanks R.
Posts.Title: decisions regarding surgery

Posts.Content: Hi all, I am nearing the end of my chemo ...woohoo!  Now I need to decide about my surgery. I met the consultant today who spoke to me about the various options. I have been told that I will have a mastectomy. I will also need radiation after the surgery. So now the big decision is about reconstruction. Do I want to have it along with the mastectomy or at a later stage. Both options seem to have their own pros and cons. Can people who have had it either way please tell me about their experience? I feel I don't want to have two surgeries but at the same time I don't want the radiation to cause any damage to my new breast.  Thanks Ramya.
Posts.Title: decisions regarding surgery

Posts.Content: I had mastectomy, Jrip. Yes Pat, surgery is easier compared to chemo. Good luck.  R.
Posts.Title: On the last leg of this horrid journey

Posts.Content: After 6  chemos, surgery and lymph node clearance I started my radiation today, 14 more to go. Feels good to say I am nearing the end of this journey. Onwards and upwards.  R.
Posts.Title: On the last leg of this horrid journey

Posts.Content: Thank you ladies.  R.
Posts.Title: On the last leg of this horrid journey

Posts.Content: Hi, I am currently going through chemo. I have had 2 sessions of FEC. I am due the third next week. After which I will have 3 sessions of T.  After my first chemo I had nausea and tiredness. I had mild temperature so had to got to A&E to have antibiotics. I am sure they must have told you all about neutropenic sepsis and what to watch out for.  After the second chemo I didn't have any major side effects other than nausea and i lost almost all of my hair after the second chemo. Of course this is just me and I've had only 2 sessions everyone is different.  Good luck with your chemo. Just remember that it is doable.  Regards, R
Posts.Title: TNBC - starting FEC-T chemo regime this friday advice needed

Posts.Content: Hi, sorry to hear about your partner's diagnosis. If it is of any reassurance, I am pretty sure my cancer was there for a while before it was diagnosed. I went to the hospital with breast abnormality in 2013 but after an ultrasound I was told it is a benign condition and I needn't worry. But in Dec 2014,when the symptoms continued and the pain got unbearable I went again and this time I was diagnosed with BC. I am pretty sure it must have been cancer that went undiagnised. However, I have finished my chemo and surgery now and the cancer has been removed completely. I am even considering returning to work in a couple of months.  It doesn't matter if its been there for a long time.  Also, its never easy when you hear the news for the first time. It takes time to come to terms.  Good luck for the treatment and hope everything goes well.  R.
Posts.Title: Partner has just been diagnosed with Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Hi, I finished my radiation therapy last August and been on Tamoxifen since. But, i started having my periods again in Nov. Last Dec, My Oncologist prescribed oophorectomy, referred me to a Gynaecologist and until the procedure happens, I was prescribed injections every 4 weeks to prevent my periods recurring. I have been having this injection since Dec.  We met the Gynaecologist in March and I was put on the waiting list for this procedure. I don't know when I will undergo this procedure. My husband's job is going to take us away from this country in July and I want to get the procedure done before that. Since we have private medical cover through his company, we are wondering if we should go private to get this done. When we consulted the insurance, they said that the procedure will be covered only it is required due to an acute medical condition. They were vague about what an acute medical condition means, but suggested that we meet a private gynaecologist who can tell the insurance why this procedure is required. The insurance will then tell us how to go about it. Has anyone been in this situation before ? We are concerned about the wait for this procedure and not sure about the insurance cover. Any advise or suggestions appreciated. R
Posts.Title: A question about private insurance

Posts.Content: Sorry that the news wasn't what you were hoping for. But involvement of lymph nodes is quite common. I had 12 nodes affected. Also, chemo is very strong and can be very effective is reducing/removing the cancer. Hope the scan goes well. Good luck.  R.
Posts.Title: Partner has just been diagnosed with Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: I agree. Reading positive stories puts me at ease when I am down. We do need more such stories.  R.
Posts.Title: Positive outcomes ...
